community.name: My Community
community.short_description: The easiest way to quickly get information about demographics, housing, education and much more across communities in Bexar County.
community.headline: My Community is a tool that allows you to explore information about demographics, housing, education and much more across communities in Bexar County.
community.long_description: Communities include Council Districts, Zipcodes, Census Tracts and SSA's, or Statistical Small Areas. SSAs are combinations of Census Tracts grouped on meaningful indicators like Race/Ethnicity, housing, age, education, and income. CINow created SSAs to help users analyze data in areas small enough to see meaningful differences across the county, yet large enough to yield better estimates.
community.get_started: To get started, browse or search for an indicator using the menu above or select a location on the map below.
community.working_add_data: We're working to add this data but it is not yet available
community.no_data_geography: No data is available for the selected geography
community.find_tooltip: Enter your address to find your Council District, SSA, Census Tract, and Zip Code

explore.name: Explore Data
explore.short_description: A deeper dive into local data through interactive mapping, trend and comparison visualization tools.
explore.headline: Explore Data is where you can take a deeper dive into the indicators about your community through interactive maps and charts.
explore.long_description: Indicators can be mapped across geographic areas, trended in charts to view that data over time, or compared to other local communities in a bar chart. You will also have the ability to filter results by location, year, race/ethnicity, sex, education level or poverty status depending on what's available from the data source. Additionally, you can download and save the visuals you create.
explore.get_started: To get started, browse or search for an indicator using the menu above or explore one of the featured indicators below.
explore.no_data_location_year: No data is available for the selected location type for this year
explore.no_data_custom_locations: No data is available for custom areas for this indicator
explore.no_data_custom_location: No data is available for this custom area for this indicator

map.name: Map
map.description: The map pulls data from multiple local, state and national data sources at the county, ZIP code, SSA (Statistical Small Area), and census tract level to display an indicators geographic distribution.

trend.name: Trend Chart
trend.description: The trend chart pulls data from multiple local, state and national data sources at the county, ZIP code, SSA (Statistical Small Area), and census tract level to display an indicator, or multiple indicators, across time.

compare.name: Comparison Chart
compare.description: The comparison chart pulls data from multiple local, state and national data sources at the county, ZIP code, SSA (Statistical Small Area), and census tract level to display an indicator, or multiple indicators, across categories.

help_messages.map: Hover over a shaded area on the map to view more information.
help_messages.trend: Hover over a point on the chart to view more information.
help_messages.compare: Hover over a column on the chart to view more information.

explore.compare_limit_exceeded: The number of comparisons selected exceeds the limit of 10. Please select fewer items to compare the data.

tables.name: Tables & Downloads
tables.short_description: Access to downloadable data in a machine-readable spreadsheet format.
tables.headline: Tables & Downloads is where you can access data in a machine-readable spreadsheet format to use in your own data processing and visualization tools.
tables.long_description: You can filter the data by location, year, race/ethnicity, education level or poverty status, depending on what is available from the data source, download and save the data tables you create.
tables.get_started: To get started, browse or search for an indicator using the menu above or select one of the featured indicators below.
tables.location_limit_exceeded: The number of locations selected exceeds the limit of 50. Please select fewer locations to filter the data.

common.click_copy: Click below to copy the link
common.click_copy_embed: Click below to copy the embed code
common.copy_failure: Sorry, we are unable to access your clipboard to automatically copy the link. Please manually copy the link above.
common.filter_unavailable: This filter is not available when combined with the other filters currently applied.
common.map_attribution: © Stadia Maps | © Stamen Design | © OpenMapTiles | © OpenStreetMap
common.chart_options_no_moe: No MOE is available for this indicator

custom_locations.name: Create Your Own Area
custom_locations.headline: Create Your Own Area is a tool where you can build your own geographies.
custom_locations.long_description: Create as many custom areas as you would like using SSAs, Council Districts, Zipcodes and Census tracts as the building blocks. Once created, users can explore and visualize data for their custom area(s) with Bexar Data Dive. Custom areas can be saved within your browser or downloaded for future use.
custom_locations.get_started: To get started, type in a name for your new custom area. Then, select the type of geography you would like to use as the building blocks to assemble your area. Start building by simply clicking geographies on the map or selecting them from the list on the right.
custom_locations.overwrite: A custom area with this name already exists. Saving will overwrite the existing location.
custom_locations.custom_name: A real location with this name already exists. Please enter a custom name.
custom_locations.open_description: Select a area from the list, or load an area file in the box below.
custom_locations.invalid_file: The file selected does not contain a valid custom area.

For more information, please visit www.minorityhealth.hhs.gov.
home_view.welcome_line_1: Welcome to Bexar Data Dive, we currently have three tools to help
home_view.welcome_line_2: you explore, visualize, and interact with data in Bexar County.

help_view.name: Help
help_view.headline: Explore frequently asked questions and learn about the tools.
help_view.guides_trainings_description: Access training materials, information, and guides to fully take advantage of everything Dive has to offer.

about_data_view.welcome: Find detailed data definitions, notes, and sources for all indicator data in Dive.
about_data_view.processed_published: Processed and published by Community Information Now for Bexar Data Dive.

about_tools_view.name: About the Tools
about_tools_view.welcome: Learn about the different tools available to access and visualize data in Dive.

faqs_view.name: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs_view.welcome: Look through answers to common questions about Dive.

announcements_view.name: Announcements
announcements_view.welcome: Learn what new features, data updates and training opportunities are available.

data.not_aggregable: This indicator cannot be aggregated for custom areas

survey.question: Please rate how useful Data Dive was on this visit
survey.feedback: Thank you for your response! Would you be willing to help us learn how Data Dive and community data are being used? If so please contact us
